text:
About 50 persons were arrested and curfew imposed in two areas after a clash between two communities here, police said on Sunday.

Trouble began in Kotwali when a man was allegedly attacked with weapons by three persons of another community in a market on Friday night, police said.

The incident led to a stampede in a market and also triggered rumours that resulted in the clash and stone-pelting between the two communities.

A 25-year-old MBA student, identified as Narendra Rajoria, suffered injuries in the attack and died during treatment in Indore on Saturday, police said.

In view of the tension, curfew was imposed in Kari-Bawdi and Malli Mohalla localities on Saturday.

About 50 people were arrested and around eight petrol bombs seized during searches, district Superintendent of Police Shashikant Shukla said, adding that heavy police force was deployed in the restive areas.

Police from neighbouring Ujjain district and Rapid Action Force (RAF) personnel were patrolling the streets. The situation was under control, the SP said. — PTI
title: Clash in M.P. town; 50 held, curfew imposed
